definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: That hand slowly to the earth covered with a thick layers of cotton.
sentences.chinese: 那巧手緩緩地給大地鋪上，一層層厚厚的棉花。

sentences.english: The green fingers of mother nature are very beautiful to me.
sentences.chinese: 大自然母親的巧手真美麗。

sentences.english: A doctor must have the heart of a lion and the hand of a lady.
sentences.chinese: 當一個醫生必須有獅子般的膽量和仙女般的巧手。

sentences.english: Once upon a time, in a small village, a great tailor lived.
sentences.chinese: 從前有一個小村子，村裏有一個巧手的裁縫。

sentences.english: Listen to these, true wild decided to put a dab hand will be in position to quit.
sentences.chinese: 聽了這些，真野決定要把巧手會的負責人職位給辭了。

definition: miraculous hands of a healer/highly skilled person/brilliant move in chess or weiqi (go) 圍棋|围棋
to be skillful with one's hands/to be manually adroit
flying needle and running seam (idiom); skillful needlework
papercutting (Chinese folk art)/to make paper cutouts
